definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The negation of the infinite leads straight to nihilism.
sentences.chinese: 对无极的否认会直接导向虚无主义。

sentences.english: Well, I would say one ends up in nihilism.
He is a nihilist who regards everything from the critical point of view.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位虚无主义，从批评的观点看待每件事情。

sentences.english: Hence the thoughts of nihilism formed Luxun' s profundity and complexity.
sentences.chinese: 虚无主义构成了鲁迅的深刻性和复杂性。

sentences.english: “He’s a loner nihilist who believes in nothing, ” Mr. Lu said.
sentences.chinese: “他是孤独的虚无主义者，没有信仰”，路金波说。

sentences.english: Jeff Skilling populates Enron with nihilists expert in gaming the system.
sentences.chinese: 斯基林带着虚无主义的专家进入埃克森。

definition: agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
voluntarism/metaphysical view, esp. due to Schopenhauer 叔本華|叔本华[Shu1 ben3 hua2], that the essence of the world is willpower
